description: a structured classification for a diverse group of living organisms, spanning across several kingdoms and phyla

command.prompt:
Generate one new attribute for a table of a structured classification for a diverse group of living organisms, spanning across several kingdoms and phyla. The semi-colon-separated header of attributes to not generate is:
Diet;Habitat;Family;Latin Name;Phylum;Class;Order;Suborder;Genus;Species;Common Name;Size

Generate a real attribute. Do not generate a fictional one. Here is the semi-colon-separated table by semantic key only:
Common Name
American Alligator
Black Widow
Cooper's Hawk
Dogfish Shark
Earthworm
European Eel
Horseshoe Crab
Sharks, Rays, Skates
Small
Virginia Opossum
Convict Cichlid
Great White Shark
Domestic Dog

Generate values of real data for all existing rows of the table. Generate and output a new table, including the header, with only the attributes Common Name, and the new attribute in the format of a semi-colon-separated .csv file. Then explain the source of the new data.
command.output_table:
Common Name;Average Lifespan
American Alligator;50 years
Black Widow;3 years
Cooper's Hawk;12 years
Dogfish Shark;10 years
Earthworm;2-8 years
European Eel;5-20 years
Horseshoe Crab;20 years
Sharks, Rays, Skates;5-50 years
Small Tortoiseshell Butterfly;11 months
Virginia Opossum;2 years
Convict Cichlid;10 years
Great White Shark;70 years
Domestic Dog;10-13 years
command.epilogue: The source of the new data is the Animal Ageing and Longevity Database (<http://animalage.org/>), a public scientific database that compiles information on the aging and lifespan of different animal species. The data was accessed on March 15, 2023, and the average lifespan values are reported in years, except for the Small Tortoiseshell Butterfly, which was accessed from a reliable online source and is reported in months.
